title: Authors and Citation

code: @Misc{morphmat,   title = {morphmat: An R package for modeling size at morphometric maturity},   author = {Ruby M. Krasnow},   year = {2024},   url = {https://github.com/rmk118/morphmat}, }

what: Modeling Size at Maturity Using Morphometric Data
title: Modeling Size at Maturity Using Morphometric Data
text: compilation methods used estimate size (sexual) maturity based morphometric data, commonly applied crabs, lobsters, crustaceans. Approaches include modeling approaches based piecewise/segmented linear regression well numerous clustering-based methods.

what: Maturity classification based on the minimum density of CH/CW ratios — infl_pt_fun
title: Maturity classification based on the minimum density of CH/CW ratios — infl_pt_fun
text: infl_pt_fun() can used classify individuals immature mature clear ratio y-axis variable x-axis variable separates immature mature clusters. example, effective classification method transition maturity population Tanner crabs (Chionoecetes bairdi) evident increase log(claw height)/log(carapace width) ratio 0.2 0.2. infl_pt_fun() finds discriminating line creating kernel density estimate (visually similar smoothed histogram) y-var/x-var ratio points, finding local minimum separating two peaks representing maturity clusters.

Maturity classification based on the minimum density of CH/CW ratios — infl_pt_fun
text: x Integer double vector measurements x-axis variable (e.g., carapace width). y Integer double vector measurements y-axis variable (e.g., claw height). plot Boolean; plot density curve identified minimum created?

title: Maturity classification based on the minimum density of CH/CW ratios — infl_pt_fun
text: integer corresponding ratio (y/x) local minimum found. ratio serves discriminant line separating observations maturity status.

title: Maturity classification based on the minimum density of CH/CW ratios — infl_pt_fun
code: library(ggplot2) set.seed(12) x <- rnorm(100, mean=2, sd=3) y <- rnorm(100, mean=10, sd=3) z <- c(x, y) hist(z)  infl_pt_fun(1, z, TRUE) #> Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggpp': #>   method                  from    #>   heightDetails.titleGrob ggplot2 #>   widthDetails.titleGrob  ggplot2  #> [1] 6.652001
